page.title: 05Henley and Falaise Link
page.content: The link was first estblished in 1972. Mrs. Rigg, whom we interviewed, has been on the committee since 1979. There are 14 people on the committee and they meet once a month. Henley chose Falaise because the towns are similar. Falaise is famous because William the Conquerer was born there and the battle of Falaise 1944. The mayor and council first thought of the link. There are activities between the two towns and two of the activities are tennis and football. Sometimes parties of people go over to Falaise to make friends.The local Secondary school, Gillotts sends parties of children every year over to Falaise.In Falaise they send parties of children over to Henley in an exchange.
